section.name: Create namespace
section.span: How to create a namespace to gather document types in?

div.p: In the Configuration slider, about to select the action 'create namespace' in the folder action menu of the hippo:namespaces folder.

A popup will come up where you define a prefix for the namespace, e.g. 'snp' or 'docs'. You also define a namespace URI, which has the form of a URL with a version number, e.g. http://www.swatia.org/newspaper/0.14 or http://www.blabla.com/docs/1.0.

section.p: Type a prefix name for the namespace. The prefix name of the namespace will be used as a prefix to all names later defined within the namespace. It it advisable to choose the prefix name of your namespaces short, so that the names within the namespace will not get unfriendly long. You need to choose a different prefix for each of your namespaces. As you will use only one or a few namespaces, that will not be a problem.

The prefix name for the namespace will probably not be unique in the whole world. Associate a long, unique name with the namespace, that has the form of a URL and that ends in a version number. This is important, as the version number will be automatically increased by the CMS when changes are made to the namespace, like changing its document types. The URL does not have to exist, but if your organization owns a website, it is good practice to use an URL your organization owns, as that guarantees it's uniqueness.
